Reviews.Content: Great product thus far. Loved the delivery service. Buying a product like this was easier than I expected from Amazon and I will look for my next big purchase to be from Amazon.com too.Thanks for making it easy!

Reviews.Title: Great Value at a Great Price.
Reviews.Author: B. McBride
Reviews.Content: This is my first HDTV and so I researched this purchase for several days and I simply could not find a better deal for the dollar. The 720p resolution looks amazing and I see no need to shell out several hundred dollars more for a 1080p unless you are purchasing a set larger than 55". Cnet has great reviews and an explanation of why you only need 720p here [...]I have been completely satisfied with the HD quality as well as the processing of standard definition shows. If you have young children I would recommend purchasing TV Armor or some other screen protector as my kids try and touch or hug the characters on Sesame Street at least once a week.Finally, the white glove delivery was very good. I live in the Texas Panhandle and the TV was in my home six days after I pressed the purchase button. I was a little disappointed that only one person delivered the unit. If it had just been my wife at home when the unit arrived I don't know how things would have worked out, so check with the driver when they call to setup the delivery.Overall, I am completely satisfied and plan on utilizing this set for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: Best Bang for your buck.
Reviews.Author: Neville Lee "Krazyfan2000"
Reviews.Content: After searching for a HD television for the last few months I came across this television at 6th ave Electronics. I looked at all the the televisions in the store and when I came across this one I was amazed at the picture. I thought it was 1080p because it looked so clear. The sales guy also sold me on this one. Even though this model is a 720p it plays up to 1080i. Outside of the blu ray which plays 1080p there is no channel on television that is 1080p. I have a PS3 and the blu ray plays amazing on it. I can't imagine the picture being any clearer than it is already. Also burn in is not an issue with this tv. I play video games all day and it doesn't effect it at all.

Reviews.Title: Great tv at good price.
Reviews.Author: Gary Labreche
Reviews.Content: While I wanted to get a Samsung 50PN550 HDTV the economic times convinced me to scale back for the time being. Instead I purchased a Samsung 50PN450, still 50" but a 720p screen. I am hooked up to Charter Cable and as a sport nut must say that for golf, basketball, hockey, and football it is fabulous. And the best part is that it cost under $900 versus $1600 for the 550. My only initial problem was being somewhat hard of hearing I like to use close captioning along with my surround sound system when watching movies. However, after checking out the model number(DCT6200)on my Motorola cable box I downloaded the manual and found that all you hve to do is turn shut off the cable box while it is still plugged in, hit the menu button, and navigate to the close caption line, enable it and then poser up again. Of course it stays on until go through the same process again but at least it is there. I am enjoying this tv very much, have no problems with burnin, and feel like I got a good deal. Delivery might have been a bit quicker as it sat in a warehouse in Indianapolis for a few days but when it did arrive the guy helped me put in down in my basement and waited until I opened the box to see that it was not damaged. However, he did not wait until it was set up and functioning as mentioned by other fortunate purchasers on this site. All in all, after three weeks I am quite satisfied with my purchase experience.

Reviews.Title: Great product and service
Reviews.Author: L. Moeller
Reviews.Content: This TV has a gorgeous picture and required no fine tuning.  It was delivered exactly as promised and promptly.  I am very pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, so-so ahipping
Reviews.Author: Jack Myers
Reviews.Content: The price on this Samsung was hard to beat. In fact, even after having it a couple of months, the local box stores still haven't come close to the Amazon price and that's with discounts! The down side was the shipping. I was given a 2-week window for the item to be shipped from Texas to North Carolina. At the end of the 2-weeks, no TV. Call me Kooky, but I get a little nervous when a near $1000 product is a no-show and the online tracking goes no further than the original load-in location in Texas two weeks prior. I emailed Amazon and got a response very quickly that they were going to look in to it. Less than 30-minutes after Amazon's response, the local shipper was on my phone (well after 5:00pm) wanting to arrange delivery the next morning. I can't help wonder how long that TV was sitting in their warehouse here in NC. Thanks Amazon for a great product and fixing the problem quickly, but you may want to look in to more expeditious freight handlers.

Reviews.Title: Up to this point all aces
Reviews.Author: drtysthrnheathen "drtysthrnheathen"
Reviews.Content: My major concern when purchasing a flat panel was the burn in issue with the plasmas.  This unit comes with a very vibrant setup to begin with... nothing short of WOW!  I have run very conservative settings on the T.V. -with 0 burn ins- up to this point, but within the month I hope to go with more enhanced settings.  I hooked up HDTV today and I am blown away at the picture quality.  There is an Entertainment feature in the setup menu.  My only suggestion, which was also passed on to me from someone who owns a smaller Samsung, is to make sure you switch the T.V. to match the media you're working with (i.e. Cinema, Sports, Game).  I always leave it running for 30 min with the scrolling screen burn protection option, just for good measure, but again absoloutely no issues whatsoever.  I haven't had second thoughts since it arrived at my house!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: dGerbz
Reviews.Content: Have enjoyed for a week now and couldn't be happier.Purchased along with the Sony BDP-S350 Blue-ray player, Logitech Z2300 speaker system, and Terk HDTVa antenna, I researched long and hard toward maximizing bang for the buck, and now reside in hi def heaven !Thank You Amazon !

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: B. White
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from amazon a couple weeks ago because it was being offered at a phenomenal price of 867 shipped with no tax. You can't get anywhere near this kind of a deal on this tv at any of my local brick and mortars. I don't think the 720p is a problem at all -- I don't have a blu-ray player so all of the content I view is either 720p or 1080i anyway. I have had not problems with buzzing, burn-in, etc. I did take some obvious precautions to burn-in like running the break-in DVD from AVS forums. All in all, a great tv.

Reviews.Title: Samsung PN50a450 Plasma TV
Reviews.Author: Molly "Molly"
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently purchased this plasma tv, after reading many review here on Amazon, as well as other places.  We upgraded from a Sony 27" tv, which we had for about 10, and this is our first plasma.I have to say I am quite impressed with this tv, the color is incredible and we don't even have an hd connection (we use fios standard), there's a picture mode called "dynamic" and when this is on, we are amazed at the clarity of colors.  I never realized that these colors could be so vibrant, it certainly makes watching a program more enjoyable.We bought the floor model at BestBuy for about $800.  I was toying with the idea of getting the 1080, but opted for the 720p based on a review we read, and when we compared the 1080 to the 720, neither one of us could see a real difference, and didn't feel it was worth the extra $700 for something we couldn't see.We have full light in the afternoon, and put it to test to see if we could still see the picture.  It wasn't a problem at all.  We saw the picture clearly.  I like that we can zoom the screen so we don't have to see those black bars that most movies have, and the swivel base is awesome.The volume is great, I had it on level 6 and could here it pretty well, and it has a speech mode so you can emphasize voice over other sounds, for those who may have a hard time hearing when the background noises seem to blend with the voices.At first I thought it may be a little to big for the living room, and it did take me a bit of time to adjust my vision to it, but i've gotten used to it.  I gave it 4 stars because we've only had it for a couple days, but overall I'm happy with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: A. Fu
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV and not the 1080P version because at that time it was $700 more. Now the gap is around $350-400 without including the NFL $200 gift card. Overall the TV has a great picture quality. I think for $250 more the 1080P might be a better buy, although you probably won't be able to tell the difference at 50''.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Completely Satisfied.
Reviews.Author: C. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV 2 weeks ago after researching for a good 2 months.  Read multiple reviews on this tv and many others, decided to go with this bad boy because of the price ($867.32) including shipping, and the quality.I had gone into Best Buy multiple times to compare the picture and get educated and in the end, if someone can see a difference between 1080 and 720 at a decent viewing distance, I am impressed with their abilities.This picture is absolutely stunning.  I have watched DVD's, played Wii, and watched plenty of tv so far and no problems with screen, burn in, image retention, or any other problems.I joke with my wife that my life consisted of BHD (before High Def) and AHD (after High Def).  Once my high def was set up, there was no looking back.Couple of things I also did, I downloaded and burned a dvd to "break in" the screen.  I ran it for probably 20 to 30 hours just as a precaution. Also I purchased a upconverting DVD player for my 700+ DVD's and noticed a "slight" improvement, but not enough to really stand out.  The DVD's already looked great on the screen after changing my DVD output to 16:9.For the price and quality, which equals value, you can't go wrong with this tv.  Good luck.

Reviews.Title: A great plasma TV
Reviews.Author: M. J. Allen
Reviews.Content: I ordered the 50 inch Samsung plasma TV last March.  Great picture - great sound!  I liked it so much, I ordered the exact same TV again this January for our basement family room.  That says it all!

Reviews.Title: Five Star TV
Reviews.Author: D. Koehn "shopping savant"
Reviews.Content: It is everything I expected and more.  I turned on the anti burn in technology right away and have not noticed any degradation of the picture.  In fact the whole set process up was not a challenge in any way.  Was going to wall amount it, but the swivel stand is so nice that I don't think I will.  Yet, most of all the picture is the best part of this TV...the color and clarity are superb. That is unless the price is really the best part.  I don't see how you could go wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: Superb image and stellar price
Reviews.Author: Dustin
Reviews.Content: I picked this unit up for less than $810 before tax.  I originally planned to get a 50" 1080p plasma, but couldn't justify the $500 more.  Trust me, at my seating distance of about 12' you cannot tell the difference.  The Samsung colors are stunning.  Do yourself a favor, if you debating over plasma vs lcd, stop  thinking and just by the plasma.  I have a Sony 40" 720p LCD and a 100" 1080p LCD projection screen system.  This plasma puts both of those displays to shame in terms of image "pop" and overall performance.  (Can't beat a 100" image for movies, however!)The single con I have is that if you are wall mounting make sure your mount moves the TV at least 4" from the wall, as Samsung uses horizontal, out the back, inputs.  So, your wires will be tight if you have a shallow wall mount.Given my purchase price I am more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: It is very good
Reviews.Author: Tuan N. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: It is great compare to its price. The picture quality is very good. I like it and recomend to every people.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice TV, Glad we purchased it!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Borowic
Reviews.Content: You are buying a Samsung.  I own three.  No this is NOT the top of the line TV, it does not have all of the bells and whistles that my LN46A750 has, it does not have a USB port.What it does have, is a stunning picture!  This is a beautiful TV!  720p HD is all you need, no one transmits in 1080p.  I have HD service from DirecTV and an up-converting DVD player with HDMI and you have jaw dropping video at all times.  The colors are rich, the picture is crisp.Yes, if you hook it up to the Wii and play a few hours of Rock Band, YOU WILL have image retention.  Retention folks, not burn in.  Run the "Scrolling" pixel shift and you will wipe any retained image in an hour or so.  Using the TV's Pixel Shift functionality will also help keep image retention under control.  I would also, change all of the standard settings - Dynamic, Standard, and Movie - from the blinding mode it comes from the factory, down to 50% for all (brightness, color, sharpness, etc.) and tune down the Contrast to 70% Movie and Standard, 75% Dynamic. You will see a stunning picture, period, as well as reduce any chance of retention or burn in.This is a fine TV, my third Samsung.  We bought this on Amazon for the family room, Pilot delivered and set up.  They came in, unboxed it, set it up and turned it on.  We could not be happier with the service.A Samsung TV, less than $900 including shipping, Amazon.com....you cannot go wrong!

Reviews.Title: Best Deal & Value on the Planet
Reviews.Author: Big Dave
Reviews.Content: This Samsung 50" 720p Plasma TV was just perfect.  Took about 10 minutes to unpack, scan over-the-air digital channels and start watching a beautiful picture.I've had the TV about a month and really like it.  I do wish Samsung had better choices in DVD-VCR combos.  They don't have tuners!  I wanted to stay with matched products (same brand), but will have to buy a different brand DVD-VCR or DVDR, etc.Bought this TV directly from AMAZON with free shipping and saved a bundle.Shipper called in advance to arrange delivery time.  Great service.

Reviews.Title: Very good value for money
Reviews.Author: Mark D. Mitchell "el marko"
Reviews.Content: Got the Samsung mounted to the wall last weekend. Was impressed with the picture quality right away. Found additional calibration setups and am even more happy with the purchase. In this price level, this set cannot be beat. I agree with the reviewers that say the Panasonic has better color reproduction but the Samsung has much sharper picture.Two weeks ago I had purchased a Toshiba 42" 120hz 1080p LCD. This Samsung absolutely blows the LCD out of the water, and for a lot less money. Back went the Toshiba....Have had no image retention (burn in) issues at all. Also the sound quality of the set is not at all bad. Plenty of sound for a normal bedroom, you may want a home theater system if used in a larger room.I gave a four star rating only because there are better sets out there, if you are willing to pay the extra cash. If you are on the fence, don't own a Blueray or Xbox 360, the only 1080p sources, then go for it. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Best Decision
Reviews.Author: J. Marshall "El Jobean"
Reviews.Content: I did a great deal of comparison shopping before buying the Samsung TV. There was no local dealer that could come close to the price I paid on Amazon. The picture is unbelievably clear and sharp. I am totally satisfied and know that I made the right choice.

Reviews.Title: Buy of the century
Reviews.Author: D. Post "DPOST"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV because of the price, hoping for, at best a mediocre quality. The TV itself is beautifully designed. The best part is the picture quality. I have this unit connected to a PS3, and the picture quality is superb. Black is black, deep and well defined, sharp definition, no jitter, no delays. I have seen units for hundred's more displaying worse quality. Don't be put of by its 720p definition, you won' t know the difference with a 1080p (I have both). Its only a matter of time, before Samsung finds out that they priced this TV 1000$ too low.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV.  Great color.  Looks Great.
Reviews.Author: Matt T. Luttrell "SoonerMatt"
Reviews.Content: I had several friends who have also purchased this TV.  I went from an older JVC 42" plasma to this.  It was much better.  It looks as good as a friend's 50" Pioneer plasma although the Pioneer has some better features.Burn in will be a problem that you need to handle.  If you play games, you will get a little burn in that is cured by using the TV's scrolling burn in tool.  For the first couple of evenings you will want to leave the TV in burn in scrolling mode while you sleep.  This will "break it in".  From my experience, TV's become exponentially less susceptible to burn in with hours.  If you do get a little this will fix it.Don't think that burn in is specific to this TV, it occurs with all plasmas I have used.There will be a light on the front that is annoying at first, but can be managed with the settings menu.Of course if you are using 50" plasmas you shouldn't expect the speakers to be any good (and they aren't).  I wish they didn't come with speakers because you should have surround anyway.The service that Amazon uses to ship is excellent.  Just make sure that you have access to the phone that you give them because they will call and try to deliver it much earlier than scheduled.  Which is great.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Thomas Lewis "Submariner"
Reviews.Content: Compared to the price most of my friends and co-workers have paid for thier HDTV, I feel I got a wonderful deal.  The picture is beautiful, sound is good, could be better, but overall I am thrilled with this machine.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture
Reviews.Author: J. Walker "jwalker006"
Reviews.Content: This is my first HDTV and it has certainly exceeded my expectations.  The price to quality of picture are excellent.  The only concern with plasma was burn in, however with a bit of care on picture sizing I don't believe this will be a problem.  Perfect for under a thousand!!!!

Reviews.Title: big screen value
Reviews.Author: Dale W. Starry "retrieversfour"
Reviews.Content: I originally decided to purchase this product after reading the Consumer REport ratings on plasma televisions. I wasn't certain whether I wanted 1080p or 720p resolution, however. I selected the 720p based on price, and have not been disappointed. The 'white glove' delivery service was a nice feature but we decided to actually unpack and set-up the unit ourselves. Not only was it easy but it was quick. The most time consuming part was programming channels. We put the unit on its built-in stand on top of our fireplace mantel, where it fits almost perfectly (like it was designed for the space) between two large storage units. I hooked up my Comcast cable box and a DVD player and we have been watching TV programs of all types and On Demand movies, etc for about a month now. The only complaint I have is with the occasional picture sizing differences that occur; I don't really understand why some channels cut off the top and bottom of the image and other channels cut off both sides.My satisfaction, however, with this Samsung model is high enough that I bought a second set for our bonus room. This set is hooked up to standard cable and now my wife can watch her programs downstairs on one 50 inch set while I watch my programs upstairs on mine. For the price, I don't believe there is a better value on the market.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 50 inch Plasma
Reviews.Author: Phillip B., Hough "clemtiger"
Reviews.Content: Awsome product at an even better price. White glove delivery was unexpected. They even put the batteries in the remote! WOW!!!My best friend bought one on my recomendation and loves his.

Reviews.Title: Terrific HDTV for an Amazing Price!!!
Reviews.Author: MBWD
Reviews.Content: This PN50A450 is a terrific plasma HDTV -- period.  Just amazing picture and quality.Now, some folks will tell you that its a compromise because its not 1080p.  But unless you sit closer than 6 ft to the TV, your eye is not physically capable of telling the difference between 720p and 1080p.  So why pay an extra $700 (almost twice the price of the PN50A450 when I got it for $820 delivered)?  Answer::  there is no reason other than the need to say you have the "better" technology.The picture is simply perfect.  My biggest worries about the plasma were burn in and glare.  The glare is a non-issue.  The anti-reflective coating is great.  Also, I come from a CRT, which had a glass screen, and the glare is better than on that tv (Sony WEGA).  The burn in will not be an issue if you run the scrolling feature for the first 200 hours (or just watch HDTV programming that does not have a static image).  There is also a free DVD download that you can download at avsforums.Not sure what else there is to say.  I've seen some of the best LCDs out there and they simply do not compare to this plasma.  Maybe in a few years, but not yet.  The motion for football and other sports is perfect on this tv, which is not true for the LCDs I've seen -- including the top rated sony XBR.If you want a great HDTV for a great price, this is your purchase.  Just do it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung PN50A450 is a lower-end TV but it does deliver exceptional picture.
Reviews.Author: R. Lee
Reviews.Content: Before I start, Pilot delivery company was great and very professional.  They called and scheduled delivery time few days in advanced and delivery was ontime and crew brought in the TV actally where I wanted it and unpacked the box and made sure there were no damage and it was working before they left.  This was normal free delivery offered by Amazon (not "white glove" service but felt like it).  And Amazon delivered several days before what was indicated on estimated delivery time.  Fast shipping!  Now for the TV...  Samsung PN50A450 is a lower-end TV but it does deliver exceptional picture.  I also have Sony 52" LCD XBR that cost 2 1/2 times more than this TV and now I can't believe I spent that much for my Sony.  Of course I can see the picture quality difference between the two but at 10' away, not much at all.  And 1080 video feed do look good on this 720p monitor as it does on native 1080p monitor.  I couldn't really tell unless you are closer to TV.  How offend do you sit and stare at your TV at 3'-5' away?  All ranges between 480 to 1080 looked great!  It also has good black and white.  Only the color should have been improved a little but most will never notice unless you are comparing it to another TV (that is high-end).  Someone mentioned that this monitor puts out a lot of heat but it's like any other plasma.  And I don't think it's much but you shouldn't completely close off the back either with custom build wall unit.  I have this TV mounted in the basement using Bello 8320 wall mount and it works great together.  I don't use this TV for games or computer display so I haven't had any burnt image issue.  Normal network logo doesn't seem to be an issue so far.  Conclusion => what a great value for the price!  This 720p monitor looks great with 1080 video.  And it delivers great picture that is comparable to high-end TV.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV, Amazing picture!
Reviews.Author: Shafique Kassam
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd TV to have delivered from Amazon. Pilot is great and called me to schedule the delivery. Two dudes brought it in slowly, unboxed it, cleaned up the trash, and even put the batteries in my remote. Now that is service!I upgraded from a Samsung 42" 4254 plasma, which I thought was perfect. But I sold it to my girlfriend and paid a couple hundo more for this 50". And I am ridiculously happy. This is in my bedroom at about 11' away viewing distance. We also have a 50" vizio 1080p in our living room, and i firmly believe that the picture on my samsung plasma is brighter and has more OOMPH and more color and is generally sexier in every regard than the 1080p vizio.Upconverted DVD's look fantastic, and DirecTV HD movie channels are also outstanding. I have not tried to pull any network channels OTA, since they are included in my satellite package. Xbox360 games and streamed Netflix movies both look great as well.I can't comment on the sound since I'm using a separate sound system. (Sony Surround Bar system HT-CT100, very nice and attractive as well, also purchased from amazon!)Overall, I've had no issues or gripes in the 2 weeks i've had this TV.

Reviews.Title: the best I ever had
Reviews.Author: Gary Alldridge
Reviews.Content: The best picture I have ever seen after you do some calibration, I use Digital Video Essentials . It Looks Better than it did in the store.

Reviews.Title: 50" hd plasma tv
Reviews.Author: David Whitlock
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with all areas of this T V and with the timely fashion in which it was delivered. Thanks Amazon.David WhitlockBardwell, Ky. 42023

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a better price!
Reviews.Author: Jamison Turner
Reviews.Content: This tv is awesome. I have a 42" in the same model and they are the best bang for the buck on the market that I've found. With my DVR and HD, the picture is as good to me as my in-laws 52" Samsung LCD 1080p at less than half the price.

Reviews.Title: Best TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: J. Faircloth "techam"
Reviews.Content: I've owned this TV for about a month and so far I Love it!  I don't have a surround sound system yet and when I first got it there were a few shows where the sound was a little buzzy.  I made a few adjustments to the sound settings and haven't had any more problems.It has plenty of connections, has a great picture, and even instant play (online) netflix movies look great on it.  I do keep grabbing the remote upside down because it seems to be weighted backwards, but that's a small complaint for such a good TV at a GREAT price.

Reviews.Title: Great Plasma Display but the audio...
Reviews.Author: (NA) DOUBLE
Reviews.Content: The image on this plasma is great.  I've upgraded from an HDTV ready Panasonic 32" CRT TV which was great but this is more than a step up.  There's only one thing...The audio coming out of the rca stereo audio output is not in sync with the sound from the plasma's built in speakers.  I have a Sony DHC-ZX50MD mini hi-fi component sound system that I generally use as a sub woofer to supplement the sound out of tv's speakers especially when watching movies for that dramatic effect.  I've had this setup since 2000 or so and have had no problems with out of sync audio.  Now that I've got the Samsung PN50A450 in place, I have this out of sync audio issue.  I double checked the settings on both the Samsung plasma and on my Sony sound system but there is no adjustment options for audio time shifting.This audio delay is occurring on all inputs used on the plasma too.  I have digital over the air antenna on the TV input, a Nintendo Wii on the AV1 input (composite), a sony 5-disc progressive dvd player on the component 2 input, an AppleTV on the HDMI1 input, and a DLO home dock deluxe on the AV2 input (composite).  The delay is the same no matter what input is used.  The delay is like a chorusing audio effect.I contacted Samsung via phone (800-SAMSUNG) on Sat 5/10/08, explained the issue, and the representative said she hasn't heard of this issue before and that there wasn't any firmware available for the Samsung PN50A450.  She set me up for an authorized service center to come and check out the plasma display.  She also said that the servicemen would more than likely be able to fix this audio issue on the spot and probably not have to return the tv for repair or for exchange.I then registered my plasma on Samsung's website and saw that the plasma was manufactured on March 30, 2008.  I bought from PC Richard in New York on 5/5/08.  Got it setup on 5/8/08.  Called Samsung for repair on 5/10/08.  The Samsung authorized service center was supposed to call me today, Monday, 5/12/08 but instead I got a call from someone at Samsung this morning suggesting that I make the call to the service center, which I found odd.Hopefully they will call me to set up a time to check out the tv, and if not I'll call them at some point this week and let you all know how this tv and the Samsung's service people work out.I really hope this is a small, fixable issue and not a widespread issue in this model.

Reviews.Title: Internal Speaker Problem
Reviews.Author: W. LaPlante
Reviews.Content: We had our plasma TV for just under 2 years when a speaker started vibrating when bass sounds were transmitted.  We had purchased a 3 year warranty for the TV (something I rarely do), but I'm glad I did.  The TV was purchased at Circuit City, and the warranty is through Assurant Solutions, who set up a warranty repair with their "local" service provider.  Assurant had set up a date for the repair, but the date came and went with no one showing up.  I called the local service provider who said they did not have the parts.  He said they would order the parts and call me for an appointment.  More than a week later I called them again and was told they had the parts and would be at my home the next day.  Again, they didn't show up.  When I called the service provider told me the service crew was working in the opposite direction from my home and could not make it.  They promised to come the next day.  The service manager came the next morning and told me that his crew said my job was "too far away", so he ended up coming.  The speakers he brought were both left hand speakers.  He had to modify one of them for the right side, but it still vibrated.  Now, I'm waiting for him to come back another day.

Reviews.Title: Good picture for the money, but worrying about burn-in is a PITA
Reviews.Author: E. Heintz
Reviews.Content: This TV has a good picture, but it's a little dim even with the settings turned up, and there's always that fear of burn-in.  I had a logo stuck in the bottom corner for a couple days and it made me wish I'd bought an LCD.  It eventually went away, but now I have to keep my settings turned down and I have to constantly worry about what I'm watching.  If you have the money, buy a good LCD.

Reviews.Title: best bang for the buck!
Reviews.Author: S. singh Dhamrhat "Desi"
Reviews.Content: You must read this!I bought this TV on March 1st, 2009 from Sears. I opened a sears card and the TV came out to only $809 BEFORE TAXES! Reviews.Title: Samsung 50" HD Plasma TV
Reviews.Author: T. Taylor
Reviews.Content: Great picture, however - I already have a Dish Network logo "screen burned" into the upper left corner. Buyers should be very careful with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Family is blown away
Reviews.Author: Melissa L. Marschall
Reviews.Content: We have searched high and low for the best tv we could find that would fit our budget. We wanted a brand we could trust. That is why we went with this tv. Packaging was great shipping was great. But the family was blown away with the first movie we watched on it (National Treasure2)  We now all fight to who gets to use it.Set up was a breeze. We also use it for gaming. When we play 4 player games it is like watching a 4 seperate 20 inch screens.

Reviews.Title: Read the 42" reviews as well
Reviews.Author: Phr3d
Reviews.Content: Samsung PN42A450 42-inch 720p Plasma HDTVthe 42" and 50" 450's are basically identical with the caveat that the posterization is easier to perceive on the 50" version, so the reviews there and elsewhere apply to this model (IMO).

Reviews.Title: Really Upset over this TV
Reviews.Author: R. PAGE
Reviews.Content: We had this Samsung 92 days.......and now burn in? Already? The manual states no fixed images more than 5% of the time? well, every station out there has their logo fixed to the screen.I am really disappointed and mad, feel the tv was just a waste of money.Have burn in on the bottom and on the left side.Nice picture though but not worth it if it gets burn in only after 90 days. I also own a 32" Samsung HD LCD that I have in the bedroom, really makes me wonder if it will do the same. The manual for that says the same thing about burn in/image retention......waaaaaa!

Reviews.Title: Hellava deal
Reviews.Author: Michael Carr "My-Key"
Reviews.Content: I waited for 4 weeks before I committed to buying this model.  The Panasonic was oK but it wasn't as clear as the Samsung.  I love the ease of using the remote and the TV not being so complicated.  Since I was concerned about the burn in issue, I've heard from many people.  I got the extra warranty ( the any and everything warranty).  But the best thing was getting this TV from Brandsmart USA for $798!!!So I think with a good Plasma I'm pleased with at a good price.  I can deal with a few criticisms.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 50" plasma 720
Reviews.Author: Roush
Reviews.Content: Not worth the Money .Does net even play media  from the USB port ( avi Files or jpegs)look for somting different like a lcd

Reviews.Title: Samsung PN50A450 50-Inch 720p Plasma HDTV
Reviews.Author: joen
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is very nice, but the audio leaves a lot to be desired, especially in the midrange.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV

Reviews.Content: This is an awesome TV!! had a great deal from BB...Wasnt sure of the 720p...but i think its great!!!

Reviews.Title: Bought this for 1000 dollars from Sears

Reviews.Content: I just ordered it from Sears for Just 1000 dollars with no payment for nearly 2 years. Cant wait to pick it up on wed.

Reviews.Author: person
Reviews.Content: I am not entirely satisfied with this product. The instructions are unclear (probably because they are written by the Japanese). It took me ages just to figure out how to operate it. Finally, I figured out that the plug needed to be inserted into the electrical outlet. It didn't say that anywhere in the directions!When I turned it on, i discovered that it only gets one channel.
